description: From Middle English bewriten, from Old English bewrītan (“to write, record, copy”); equivalent to be- (“about, over”) +‎ write. Compare Dutch beschrijven (“to describe”), German beschreiben (“to describe”), Swedish beskriva (“to describe”).

verbs.description: bewrite (third-person singular simple present bewrites, present participle bewriting, simple past bewrote, past participle bewritten)

examples: I vow and purpose, here in the presence of " Billy Shakspeare," to bewrite this ill-starred foolscap!!
After I bewrote thee yesterday Mrs. Neville drove Lady Charlotte, young Bagot (Clerk) and self into Glastonbury.
